meanings.definition: A small North American tree or shrub with white flowers and edible fruit.
meanings.sent1: The shadblow tree in the park has beautiful white flowers.
meanings.sent2: I picked some ripe shadblow fruit from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels had a party under the shadblow tree, munching on the fruit.
meanings.sent4: Her smile bloomed like the delicate white flowers of a shadblow tree.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of the shadblow fruit filled the air.

meanings.definition: The fruit of the shadblow tree.
meanings.sent1: The birds feasted on the juicy shadblow.
meanings.sent2: She made a delicious pie using shadblow as the main ingredient.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended the shadblow fruit were tiny bombs in their game.
meanings.sent4: The basket overflowed with the colorful shadblow fruit.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the shadblow exploded in her mouth with sweetness.

meanings.definition: To produce or bear shadblow fruit.
meanings.sent1: The tree will shadblow in the next season.
meanings.sent2: She hopes her garden will shadblow plentifully this year.
meanings.sent3: The farmer's field seemed to shadblow overnight with ripe fruit.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work finally shadblowed into a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent5: The orchard shadblows with the promise of a fruitful year ahead.
